timeline.bodyText: Why not make this the default style for a typeahead?
timeline.author: Tristan2357

timeline.bodyText:
Is there a way to make this dynamic?
Also i personally do not like the look of the button in this size, as it seems bloated and empty. I would prefer it, if this button would not fill the space, but instead just gets a small padding around the icon (4px or 6px maybe). If you prefer the bigger button just ignore this comment.
timeline.author: Tristan2357
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -30,54 +36,73 @@

{{workbasket.name}} + + + -

replies.bodyText: maybe we can exchange ideas how to design this button
replies.author: cnguyen-de

timeline.bodyText: Why is read not default true, but set to true after creation?
timeline.author: Tristan2357

replies.bodyText: sure, this was however just a rewrite of the old implementation so I kept it 1:1
replies.author: cnguyen-de

timeline.bodyText:
should this not wait for the completion of the store.dispatch?
because right now this will immediatly set it to false after setting to true.
timeline.author: Tristan2357
Tristan2357

replies.bodyText: not sure how it made to a commit, will be changed
replies.author: cnguyen-de

timeline.bodyText: is there an issue created for this? if yes maybe refernce it here and make this comment a TODO
timeline.author: Tristan2357
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,10 @@
+// Remnant from old design, needs to be removed, type reference should instead => models/Links.ts

timeline.bodyText: Why do we declare every attribute again? Should the inheritance not be enough?
timeline.author: Tristan2357
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,28 +1,27 @@
 import { Links } from './links';
 import { ICONTYPES } from './icon-types';
+import { WorkbasketSummary } from './workbasket-summary';
 
-export class Workbasket {
-  constructor(
-    public workbasketId?: string,
-    public created?: string,
-    public key?: string,
-    public domain?: string,
-    public type: ICONTYPES = ICONTYPES.PERSONAL,
-    public modified?: string,
-    public name?: string,
-    public description?: string,
-    public owner?: string,
-    public custom1?: string,
-    public custom2?: string,
-    public custom3?: string,
-    public custom4?: string,
-    public orgLevel1?: string,
-    public orgLevel2?: string,
-    public orgLevel3?: string,
-    public orgLevel4?: string,
-    public _links: Links = {}
-  ) {
-  }
+export interface Workbasket extends WorkbasketSummary {

replies.bodyText: can remove the inheritance, it isn't used at all now
replies.author: cnguyen-de

timeline.bodyText: The typeahead in access items management looks really off now, this should be fixed, to be consistent with the other typeaheads
timeline.author: Tristan2357

timeline.bodyText:
a take(1) would suffice in this case, as far as i can see, because we do not activate Route again.
This is just a preference and should not change anything
timeline.author: Tristan2357

replies.bodyText: when the user changes the route manually via browser address, it needs a subscription to detect these changes. Without it you need to enter twice to force refresh the site.
replies.author: cnguyen-de

timeline.bodyText:
why does this not just use a Sorting and a Filter as parameters?
This would ease understandability and readability in my opinion.
timeline.author: Tristan2357

replies.bodyText: because this would means also changing the service file while I did not want to, may cause unexpected bugs
replies.author: cnguyen-de

timeline.bodyText: Maybe even get this to use Filter and Sorting
timeline.author: Tristan2357

timeline.bodyText:
We do we not continue to test these tests?
Are they broken or unneccessary?
If broken, why not fix them or create a ticket for fixing them, while ignoring them (with xit)
timeline.author: Tristan2357

replies.bodyText: we can ignore them and overhaul the whole unit tests
replies.author: cnguyen-de

timeline.author: Tristan2357

timeline.bodyText:
again, i do not see the benefit of a function just returning an object, when we could just create the object without problem. This function does not even increase readability, as i will not know which attribute gets assigned a '1' or a ''.
Maybe i am missing something
timeline.author: Tristan2357

timeline.bodyText: Again, why are we removing all the tests? Are they not relevant anymore or just broken. When broken please fix or create a ticket for them and disable them for now.
timeline.author: Tristan2357

replies.bodyText: some of them are totally broken due to the implementation of the store, new ticket should be created for this while we overhaul the whole unit tests
replies.author: cnguyen-de
